paper_abstract: We introduce a method for solving substitution ciphers using low-order letter n-gram models. This method enforces global constraints using integer programming, and it guarantees that no decipherment key is overlooked. We carry out extensive empirical experiments showing how decipherment accuracy varies as a function of cipher length and n-gram order. We also make an empirical investigation of Shannon's [12] theory of uncertainty in decipherment.
paper_title: Attacking Letter Substitution Ciphers with Integer Programming
